page.title: 06Housing In Dymchurch
page.content: The oldest cottages are in the middle of the village.They are C15.There are bigger Tudor houses near the church including The Old Manor House,New Hall & Clissold Cottage.These are red brick with hanging tiles.Many of the newer houses are on estates built after the Second World War.New building regulations forbid the building of bungalows & any houses North of the light railway.A questionnaire given to Junior School children showed the sort of houses in which we live: TYPE OF HOUSE AMENITIES bungalow 23% garage 52% 2 storeys 61% garden 78% 3 storeys 6% phone 79% flat 3% micro-wave caravan 7% oven 61% semi-detached 35% cent.heating 62% terraced house 21% dish-washer 14%
